intro: Stylagrostis erythrostachya, commonly known as the red-stemmed stylagrostis, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking red stems and showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in wetlands and along riverbanks, thriving in moist, sunny environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both ecological studies and horticultural cultivation.
